column5: I just returned from there and the water is as high as I've ever seen it. A few buoys are now missing too, so be careful. The Deception ramp only had two concrete slabs out of the water. The second ramp was totally underwater. I hope this helps.
WOW ! Thats a TON of extra water... How was the bite? MY WEATHER CHANNEL still shows rain every day... Hope not, but it is what it is....
That weather channel app showing rain everyday will change I assure you,on all my trips I look at the long range forecast and shows rain everyday,it will change!!

The bite was fantastic like always. We caught a lot of slots and overs this trip too. Biggest was 26". Lots of 30+ inch pike too. Biggest was 40". The water temp was 68 and the fish were on mid-lake humps. Usually 22-25 feet deep. We did get some as deep as 30 feet. Good luck and have fun!

I just looked at the weather channel again for Sioux Lookout, the weather still looks good for when you will be here except Thursday, possibly Friday. Don't worry about the %, 40% and less is nothing on the Weather Channel, it is always like that, seldom you ever see a 0%. Look at the 24 hr rain amounts, those are the important numbers. Your week looks better than most have been all summer.
Thanks for the tips.... Looks like the usual type of area we find them in that time of year..
Hi Guys ! Headed up to Chamberlain area of Lac Seul Saturday the 10th. just wondering how hi the water levels are? I see rain is forecast for every day We are there.... .... Hope not, but...
Bring a umbrella.Water still high on west side
I don't know what forecast you are looking at, but the weather channel is showing great weather for the next two weeks. Best weather we have seen all summer.

[QUOTE=Skywagon;6683934][QUOTE=jimirjr;6683826]Hi Guys ! Headed up to Chamberlain area of Lac Seul Saturday the 10th. just wondering how hi the water levels are? I see rain is forecast for every day We are there.... [IMG class=inlineimg]https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums/images/smilies/ooo.gif[/IMG]....Your absolutly right Steve.Diffinatlylooking good for a while and wind pretty good to.ill be on the water a while so looking forward to it

I looked at the water level on Lac Seul on www.lwcb.ca to see that the reservoir pool is just about normal for this time of year. I also looked at Lake St. Joseph to see that the flood gates are open and that water is being diverted to lac Seul instead of the Albany River.

[QUOTE=prov1800;6683936][QUOTE=Skywagon;6683934]Right now I am sitting in the cabin enjoying some alone time waiting for the fog to burn off before I go fishing. It is currently sunny (above the fog), 50 degrees with no wind, definitely great weather. One of my 4 favorite seasons to be living in northwestern Ontario.
[QUOTE=Skywagon;6684004][QUOTE=prov1800;6683936]Hope to see that weather sept 24,cold n snow ok,wind is a no no.
I would like to see the snow hold off until freeze-up this year (late October), we are due for a nice fall.
Last year 1st week of Oct it was like mid summer up there,went up only brought cold weather clothes, there a good chance that won't happen again.
